## Purpose
Version and metadata declaration file for the `requests` HTTP library. This file centralizes all package metadata constants used for distribution, documentation, and runtime identification.

## Key Elements
- **Package Metadata (L5-13)**: Standard Python package metadata constants including title, description, URL, version, author information, and licensing
- **Version Information (L8-9)**: String version "2.32.3" (L8) and hexadecimal build number 0x023203 (L9) for programmatic version checking
- **Easter Egg (L14)**: Unicode cake emoji string `__cake__` containing sparkles and cake symbols

## Dependencies
None - pure metadata constants file with no imports or external dependencies.

## Architectural Notes
- Follows standard Python packaging conventions for `__version__.py` files
- Hexadecimal build number (L9) allows for efficient version comparison and internal build tracking
- All constants use double-underscore naming convention indicating they are part of the public package API
- ASCII art header (L1-3) spells "requests" using text characters

## Usage Pattern
Typically imported by `__init__.py` to expose version information to package consumers via `requests.__version__`, `requests.__author__`, etc.
